summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from March 2019 discussing coordination for a teleconference regarding the Jeffrey Epstein case. It involves FBI agents from New York and Miami offices and references a request from DOJ OPR to review a file. The emails show planning for a call to touch base on the case, mentioning travel restrictions due to a government shutdown.

persons.name: I. (NY) (FBI)
persons.context: Appears as the sender of the main email on March 1, 2019, providing RMD POC information and referencing the teleconference setup.

persons.name: (MM) (FBI)
persons.context: Appears as a recipient and sender in the email chain, coordinating the teleconference regarding the Epstein case and requesting POC information for Records Management.

persons.name: (NY) (FBI)
persons.context: Appears as a sender in earlier emails (Jan 2019) setting up the teleconference call details and expressing desire to travel to Florida to meet about the Epstein case.

connections.description: FBI colleagues communicating about case coordination and sharing POC information for Records Management.
FBI colleagues from New York and Miami offices coordinating a teleconference regarding the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Scheduled Epstein case teleconference
events.description: A teleconference call was scheduled for 11am involving FBI agents and AUSAs to discuss the Epstein case.

events.title: Teleconference planning for Epstein case
events.description: FBI agents discussed setting up a teleconference to touch base on the Epstein case due to travel restrictions from the government shutdown.

events.title: DOJ OPR file review request
events.description: DOJ Office of Professional Responsibility reached out to review a file related to the Epstein case.

keyFacts: FBI agents from New York and Miami were coordinating a teleconference in early 2019 to discuss the Jeffrey Epstein case.
The government shutdown was cited as preventing FBI agents from traveling to Florida for in-person meetings about the case.
DOJ Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) had reached out to review a file related to the Epstein investigation.
The email chain shows ongoing inter-office FBI coordination on the Epstein case in January-March 2019.
References to 'RMD - Div 17' and Records Management POC suggest document management aspects of the investigation.
